riskAlert.title: Don't put yourself and your client at risk.
riskAlert.description: Using unlicensed software can result in fines, lawsuits, and damage to your company's reputation. But most importantly: it compromises the trust your client places in you. Adopting Software Compliance is an ethical, preventive, and professional approach.

compliance.title: About Software Compliance
compliance.description: Software Compliance means using programs according to their licenses, respecting copyrights and intellectual property. It's an essential practice for companies that value ethics, security, and sustainability.

legal.title: Legal Compliance
legal.description: Avoid fines and lawsuits by keeping your licenses up to date and documented.

security.title: Guaranteed Security
security.description: Original software receives security updates, protecting your data and systems.

reputation.title: Business Reputation
reputation.description: Demonstrate professionalism and ethics, strengthening trust with clients and partners.

sketchup.title: SketchUp for Architects and Engineers
sketchup.subtitle: Since 2018, Trimble has intensified anti-piracy actions in Brazil. Architecture and engineering offices are being notified and fined daily.

itca.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: ITCA is active in Brazil
itca.description: ITCA (IT Compliance Association) was hired by Trimble to identify irregular use of SketchUp. They have integrated technology that automatically detects unlicensed copies, even in small offices with less than 5 employees.

financial.title: Heavy Fines
financial.description: Amounts applied by ITCA vary according to the number of machines identified. Additionally, attorney fees can increase the final amount by up to 50%.

legal.title: Criminal Consequences
legal.description: In Brazil, copyright violation results in compensation payment and can lead to imprisonment. The law provides for search and seizure of pirated copies.

professional.title: Reputation at Risk
professional.description: Companies caught with pirated software lose market credibility and may be prevented from participating in public tenders.
